alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Ontario; Wayne (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wayne, east central Monroe and Ontario Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking several strong thunderstorms over Ontario county. One was near Victor, moving north at 25 mph and another one near Canandaigua moving north northeast at 20 mph. Both storms are generating tropical downpours that will result in one to two inches of rain. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Geneva, Canandaigua, Fairport, Newark, Lyons, Palmyra, Victor, Clifton Springs, Phelps, Bloomfield, Farmington, Gorham, Manchester, Macedon, Shortsville, Seneca Lake State Park, Seneca Castle, West Junius, Fairville, and Port Gibson. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 42 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
